Class AdminUserRegistration

java.lang.Object
ticktocktrack.gui.AdminUserRegistration
public class AdminUserRegistration extends Object
Class responsible for creating the Admin User Registration UI components.

  • Method Details

    • createBasePanel

      private static javafx.scene.layout.Pane createBasePanel()
      Creates the base pane for the registration panel with styling and drop shadow effect.
      Returns:
      a styled Pane to be used as the base container for the registration UI.

    • createExitButton

      private static javafx.scene.control.Button createExitButton(javafx.scene.layout.Pane panel)
      Creates an exit button ("X") that hides the specified panel when clicked.
      Parameters:
      panel - the Pane that should be hidden when the exit button is clicked.
      Returns:
      a styled Button configured as an exit control.

    • createDoneButton

      private static javafx.scene.control.Button createDoneButton(double x, double y)
      Creates a styled "Done" button positioned at the specified coordinates.
      Parameters:
      x - the X coordinate for the button's layout position
      y - the Y coordinate for the button's layout position
      Returns:
      a Button styled as a "Done" button

    • createTextField

      private static javafx.scene.control.TextField createTextField(String prompt, double x, double y, double width, double height)
      Creates a styled TextField with the specified prompt text, position, and size.
      Parameters:
      prompt - the prompt text to display inside the TextField
      x - the X coordinate for the TextField's layout position
      y - the Y coordinate for the TextField's layout position
      width - the preferred width of the TextField
      height - the preferred height of the TextField
      Returns:
      a TextField styled with border and background colors

    • createPasswordField

      private static javafx.scene.control.PasswordField createPasswordField(String prompt, double x, double y, double width, double height)
      Creates a styled PasswordField with the specified prompt text, position, and size.
      Parameters:
      prompt - the prompt text to display inside the PasswordField
      x - the X coordinate for the PasswordField's layout position
      y - the Y coordinate for the PasswordField's layout position
      width - the preferred width of the PasswordField
      height - the preferred height of the PasswordField
      Returns:
      a PasswordField styled with border and background colors

    • createPasswordFieldWithToggle

      public static javafx.scene.layout.Pane createPasswordFieldWithToggle(String prompt, double x, double y, double width, double height)
      Creates a Pane containing a PasswordField with a toggle feature to show/hide password text. The password is initially hidden, but the user can toggle visibility by switching between a PasswordField and a TextField with the same content.
      Parameters:
      prompt - the prompt text to display inside the password input fields
      x - the X coordinate for the Pane's layout position
      y - the Y coordinate for the Pane's layout position
      width - the preferred width of the password input fields
      height - the preferred height of the password input fields
      Returns:
      a Pane containing the password input fields with toggle functionality

    • getPasswordFromPane

      public static String getPasswordFromPane(javafx.scene.layout.Pane pane)
      Retrieves the password text from the given Pane that contains a PasswordField and a TextField. If the TextField (showing password in plain text) is visible, its text is returned. Otherwise, the PasswordField's text is returned.
      Parameters:
      pane - the Pane containing password input fields
      Returns:
      the current password text, or an empty string if none found

    • showAlert

      private static void showAlert(javafx.scene.control.Alert.AlertType alertType, String title, String message)
      Displays an alert dialog on the JavaFX application thread.
      Parameters:
      alertType - the type of alert (e.g., INFORMATION, ERROR)
      title - the title of the alert window
      message - the message content displayed in the alert
